newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate, baht firm in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate, baht firm in late trade.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate firmed to 8.00-8.25 percent in late trade on Friday from 7.00 percent earlier and 6.25-6.50 percent late on Thursday on a tighter money supply, dealers said.
"Some banks have begun to keep funds back for the next reserve requirement in anticipation of a rise in the interbank rate next week," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
Dealers said the money supply is likely to tighten next week as a result of corporate tax payments, due very two months.
The baht firmed to 25.293-25.296 to the dollar in late trade compared with 25.25.297-25.302 in the morning on higher demand for baht, dealers said.
"Trade was very light today. There was some dollar selling (for baht) in the morning as local short-term baht interest rates firmed," said a currency dealer.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate unchanged at 25.29 baht to the dollar.
